ygData.subject: Re: Fear and level 16 spell questions
ygData.msgSnippet: But it sure doesn t help for the tank that who just got buffed by you, your cleric, and your shaman when he gets charmed or rooted. How long would it take to
ygData.messageBody:
But it sure doesn't help for the tank that who just got buffed by you, your
cleric, and your shaman when he gets charmed or rooted. How long would it
take to cast cancel magic 9 times?

Of course, once you got rid of all his buffs he'd most likely be dead meat
anyway...

I just had a revelation though. Given that magic works the same for mobs as
it does for us, if cancel magic cancelled in a LIFO order like I had been
wanting it to, you'd run the risk of cancelling the DoTs and what-not that
your party has cast on the mob. Still, I think I'd rather worry about that
than having to cancel all of someone's buffs just to unroot them.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Brewhaus [SMTP:brewhaus@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 01, 1999 12:03 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Fear and level 16 spell questions
>
> From: Brewhaus <brewhaus@...>
>
> This problem is very easily overcome. First off you can simply left click
> all of your buffs away, ussualy you can manually get rid of them. Or, if
> that doesn't work, try this. Before you fight and buff if you know you
> will be fighting something casting a magical effect on you, cast an
> illusion on yourself and then buff. Then when you prepare to fight left
> click the illusion off freeing up the first spot. Easy as that.
>
> Aarreran
> Mithaniel Marr
> Ad Infinitvm
>
>
> ---"Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...> wrote:
> >
> > From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
> >
> > So to get rid of that DoT I will have to get rid of all of my buffs too?
> >
> > What a waste of a spell...
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Tim Borelli [SMTP:timb@...]
> > > Sent: Thursday, July 01, 1999 9:09 AM
> > > To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Fear and level 16 spell questions
> > >
> > > From: Tim Borelli <timb@...>
> > >
> > > cancel removes the topmost spell cast on you... i believe either strip
> > > enchantment or nullify magic will remove ALL spells cast on you... not
> > > sure
> > > which tho...
> > >
> > > Qorona Mindbender of the Volition Guild, 25th lvl enchanter on
> Cazic-Thule
> > >
> > > At 08:22 AM 7/1/99 -0500, you wrote:
> > > >From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
> > > >
> > > >If you are buffed up and get hit with a DoT from an enemy necro, does
> > > cancel
> > > >magic cancel the spell icons in a Last-In-First-Out order, or a
> > > >First-In-First-Out order? In other words, am I gonna hafta cast it 4
> > > times
> > > >to get rid of that one DoT...
> > > >
> > > >> -----Original Message-----
> > > >> From: XIII [SMTP:dlepriol@...]
> > > >> Sent: Tuesday, June 29, 1999 7:12 PM
> > > >> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> > > >> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Fear and level 16 spell questions
> > > >>
> > > >> From: XIII <dlepriol@...>
> > > >>
> > > >> Yes,
> > > >>
> > > >> the Taper enchantment line of spells. Main battle opener when I go
> > > against
> > > >> any elem or any spell caster (better suited to team work in that
> case
> > > with
> > > >> a close by wizard doing his stuff right after me. Better check
> > > respective
> > > >> CT though). And the added part being you can cast it, it wont
> register
> > > as
> > > >> an agressive spell on mob (plus its great when you suffer necro DOT
> > > >> spells)
> > > >>
> > > >> Ibnabeth
> > > >> Karana
> > > >>
> > > >> At 10:20 29/06/1999 -0500, you wrote:
> > > >> >From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
> > > >> >
> > > >> >Are you talking about Cancel Magic/Strip Enchantment?
> > > >> >
> > > >> >> -----Original Message-----
> > > >> >> From: XIII [SMTP:dlepriol@...]
> > > >> >> Sent: Tuesday, June 29, 1999 2:04 AM
> > > >> >> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> > > >> >> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Fear and level 16 spell questions
> > > >> >>
> > > >> >> From: XIII <dlepriol@...>
> > > >> >>
> > > >> >> On elementals,
> > > >> >>
> > > >> >> If you are talking of fire elem like the ones I hunt in
> > > lavastorm,
> > > >> >> you're
> > > >> >> mistaken. They deal most damage by the fire shield they cast on
> > > >> themsleves
> > > >> >> (the message 'youre burned'). And guess what, we may have the
> right
> > > >> line
> > > >> >> of
> > > >> >> spells for this very purpose. Added bonus, this spell does not
> > > register
> > > >> >> yet
> > > >> >> as aggressive. It works just fine on gnoll shamans too as my
> deear
> > > >> >> departed
> > > >> >> rexx would say.
> > > >> >>
> > > >> >> Ibnabeth
> > > >> >> Karana
> > > >> >>
> > > >> >> At 13:52 28/06/1999 -0700, you wrote:
> > > >> >> >From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>
> > > >> >> >
> > > >> >> >It's my understanding that quickness now lasts 5 minutes. Just
> > > cast
> > > >> it
> > > >> >> >on yourself and start a stop watch.
> > > >> >> >
> > > >> >> >I use the fear strategy on things that hit too hard, like
> > > elementals.
> > > >> >> >For their level they pound harder than you would expect. I
> keep
> > > >> memory
> > > >> >> >blur memorized, too, so that I can get rid of any extra
> beasties
> > > that
> > > >> >> >frenzy as my feared target runs by. Obvioulsy this is only
> > > effective
> > > >> >> >in areas where you know the terrain and know that you can
> handle
> > > >> >> >anything that comes along, as an individual anyway.
> Mesmerizing a
> > > >> >> >frenzy candidate and then bluring it after you pass by will
> keep
> > > you
> > > >> >> >out of harm's way.
> > > >> >> >
> > > >> >> >If all hell breaks loose you should have a few seconds before
> the
> > > >> >> >frezied beasts kill your pet. Use that time to Gate because
> invis
> > > >> will
> > > >> >> >do no good.
> > > >> >> >
> > > >> >> >Q
> > > >> >> >
> > > >> >> >--- Scott Murawski <scott@...> wrote:
> > > >> >> >> From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> >From: jcent@...
> > > >> >> >> >
> > > >> >> >> >So the question is
> > > >> >> >> >Suppose I fear a wisp and I have a pet. If I just
> > > >> >> >> stand where I am and not
> > > >> >> >> >follow, will my pet following the wisp cause a
> > > >> >> >> train if wisps are in the
> > > >> >> >> >area?
> > > >> >> >> >
> > > >> >> >> >>Probably so....they will attack your pet first,
> > > >> >> >> then you...beware.
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> Yeah, thats what I figured. Thats why I haven't
> > > >> >> >> been casting it.
> > > >> >> >> Thanks for confirmation
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> >>Yes, requires a lot of mana....save it for the
> > > >> >> >> main tank in your
> > > >> >> >> >group....and cast only after melee starts....it
> > > >> >> >> doesn't last long...maybe 2
> > > >> >> >> >or 3 minutes...
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> WOAH, I was getting the impression it only lasted 30
> > > >> >> >> seconds or something
> > > >> >> >> like that.
> > > >> >> >> Two or 3 minutes is way longer than I thought.
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> >>requires Cats Eye Agate...about 2g each
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> Could get expensive...
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> --------
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> I've been hunting in black burrow and kerra isle.
> > > >> >> >> Now, when I get to level
> > > >> >> >> 15, I won't get much in the way
> > > >> >> >> of experience. Is there a zone near black burrow
> > > >> >> >> which is good to hunt at
> > > >> >> >> 15 and up?
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> Also, it took around 60 plat to get my main level 12
> > > >> >> >> spells. How much is
> > > >> >> >> the estimate to get your main level 16 spells?
> > > >> >> >> Since I'm on the topic of
> > > >> >> >> plat, are there any zones near black burrow which
> > > >> >> >> aren't incredibly
> > > >> >> >> dangeous (like bb) which give good loot so I can
> > > >> >> >> withstand the onslaught of
> > > >> >> >> plat comming out of my bank?
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> Thanks
> > > >> >> >>
> > > >> >> >> Azboklin the enchanter
> > > >> >> >>
